title: Functionally extraordinary
text:
Once I figured out HOW to connect a speaker to my WiFi network (using the WPS or password options), it became easier to learn this app. That part was the most frustrating step in connecting. The app itself attempts to walk the user through it, but some steps aren‚Äôt clear‚Äîlike how to get the white SLOW pulse. I still have no idea for what the other faster pulses are used.

This app is complex, with its numerous options available to the user, but I enjoy having the freedom to connect my DT speakers the way I want and listen to my libraries and playlists how I want. And, when there is a technical difficulty (like a disconnect), there are options to troubleshoot the problem and reconnect. Again, the complexity of this app seems purposeful and allows the user the freedom to choose from more options than the ordinary app. I am able to walk through my house and hear my music in various rooms without running wires in the attic or crawl space. Using the WiFi in my house as it‚Äôs network works very well and is satisfying. Overall, I‚Äôm enjoying this app very much.

title: Good but could be better
text:
Since upgrading my WiFi system to Orbi, this app is actually working again! For the last two years, every time I would try to use the app, it would constantly be ‚Äúreconnecting‚Äù ...only working for a minute or two before reconnecting once again. I actually stopped using the app altogether, turning the functionality of my houseful of speakers, nearly useless (unless I plugged a phone directly onto one of them via mini audio jack). I upgraded my WiFi system to Orbi last month and have been successfully using the Def Tech app ever since! I‚Äôm so happy to hear music streaming through my entire house on the same note once again! 
Having said that, the system does have to ‚Äúreconnect‚Äù every once in a while and I‚Äôm not sure why.
Also, I regularly need to log back into my SiriusXM account when I start up the app, which is a little frustrating. 
Once suggestion for improvement I have for the app is that it would be great to control the volume for each speaker via a numerical system, say 1 - 40. Where you could turn the kitchen speaker up one tick and the soundbar down two ticks. Currently, the speakers each use a slide bar to change the volume they don‚Äôt have fine attenuation control (i.e., you may move one right a millimeter and nothing happens, then right another millimeter and volume jumps up 20 decibels.)
All of my speakers would greatly benefit from finer volume attenuation control (especially in the very low volumes) and replacing the slide bar with a numeric control would also be greatly appreciated.
Also, I agree with the requests to add Apple Music as a music service. That is a requirement in this day and age.

Then install 1 speaker at a time.  If you want surround sound (which I use with the sound bar and 2 W7‚Äôs, setup that last. title: Very balky playback with SiriusXM
text:
Update Feb 2021:  one would think after this time SOMETHING would have improved but no, nothing has. Let me reiterate:  my wifi is excellent and I have no problems connecting independently to them SiriusXM app.  But to do so via this mechanism is horrible.  Half the time it cycles forever ‚Äúreconnecting‚Äù.  When it does, half the time I cannot load a station and instead am told ‚Äúdifficulty downloading genres‚Äù.  When I finally do get to a station, I can listen for anywhere from 5 to 120 minutes before it decides to disconnect itself.  The only reason I bother with this app is to listen to music using the sound bar without tuning in to the TV.  Will someone at Definitive ever take this issue seriously?  Or is this app so secondary to their business model that they don‚Äôt really care??

I have been struggling with the app for this sound bar for quite some time.  I like the idea of streaming directly to the sound bar and avoid tuning on the TV.  But, if only the darn thing would work reliably.

I will start-up SiriusXM, for which I have a subscription.  Half the time I can‚Äôt select a channel; instead I get an error message that says ‚Äúcannot download genre‚Äù.  When I do get in, I can start streaming fine.  But after anywhere between 5 minutes and 2 hours the thing quits streaming; it tells me it is ‚Äútrying to connect‚Äù.  I will manually connect and it will stream again for a few minutes then quit.  Sometimes if I force-close the app and re-open it, it will work again for a while; sometimes it does not.

The Definitive tech support staff are less than helpful.  They blame my internet connection (I have no trouble streaming 4K video from Netflix or YouTube or Amazon).  Or they will blame SiriusXM, even though I can listen uninterrupted on the iPad or laptop.  So the problem is with the Definitive app and they appear unwilling and unable to address the problem.

Nice concept; poorly executed.
